intro: Diospyros yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan persimmon, is a deciduous tree native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, ovate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into orange-red, fleshy fruits with a sweet, astringent flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry forests and limestone soils.
